title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. The fourth

C. The fifth

D. The sixth

---

2. The Supreme Court kept pandemic-era border controls in place. A dissenting opinion by Neil Gorsuch was joined by which other justice?

A. Samuel Alito

B. Amy Coney Barrett

C. Brett Kavanaugh

D. Ketanji Brown Jackson

---

3. Companies are offering salary bumps to lure employees to a profession that lost 300,000 members in the last two years. Which one?

A. Accounting

B. Dentistry

C. Engineering

D. Hair styling

---

4. A senior German intelligence officer arrested as a Russian spy had access to top-secret intelligence on the war in Ukraine. How was he identified by prosecutors?

A. Uwe G.

B. Klaus W.

C. Carsten L.

D. Gunter F.

---

5. Efforts to bring back the majestic American chestnut tree have resulted in a genetically engineered version -- called what?

A. Darling 58

B. Paris 32

C. Cole-Torme 26

D. Mila 18

---

6. Lockheed Martin protested a government decision to award a huge new helicopter contract to someone else. Who?

A. Boeing

B. Northrop

C. Textron

D. All of the above

---

7. Severe weather triggered mass flight cancellations at Southwest Airlines. Who's the CEO?

A. Robin Charles

B. Bob Jordan

C. Ed Hudson

D. Roberta Nile

---

8. Congressman-elect George Santos admitted to lying about his biography. Where did he claim to have gotten a degree?

A. Iona College

B. Stony Brook University

C. Baruch College

D. Huxley University

---

9. Monk parakeets, native to South America, have become an unlikely fixture underneath an elevated highway -- in what city?

A. Cincinnati

B. Chicago

C. Minneapolis

D. Detroit

---

ANSWERS

1. D

2. D

3. A

4. C

5. A

6. C

7. B

8. C

9. B
